alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 10:32PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a large area of thunderstorms with torrential rain extending from Ravenel and Hollywood south to Wadmalaw Island and Edisto Island. This activity will slowly move east and impact areas from Downtown Charleston into much of western Charleston County through midnight. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches could produce minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johns Island, West Ashley, James Island, Downtown Charleston, Fort Sumter, Hollywood, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Rockville, Wadmalaw Island, Yonges Island, Bears Bluff, Maybank Bridge and James Island County Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
